definition: to overturn/to overthrow/to strike down (an enemy)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to work hard towards a turnaround/to fight to reverse sth

sentences.english: Min hao knocked over the dishes, told Xia Chan dint want to see her again.
sentences.chinese: 旻皓打翻了菜肴，向夏婵表示不希望再见到她。

sentences.english: He carelessly knocked over the silkworm tray, leaving the floor covered with folia mori.
sentences.chinese: 他一不小心打翻了蚕匾，桑叶散满了一地。

sentences.english: I've upset a cup of coffee on my shirt.
sentences.chinese: 我打翻了一杯咖啡，洒在我的衬衫上了。

sentences.english: Six more test-tubes of spermatozoa were upset.
sentences.chinese: 又有六支精子管打翻了。

sentences.english: A: I'm sorry for spilling my drink on your rug.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我把饮料打翻在你的地毯上了。

sentences.english: The first five-foot wave tipped it over.
sentences.chinese: 第一个5英尺高的波浪就把浮标打翻了。

sentences.english: With that overturned, the clan authority and the authority of the husband all begin to totter.
sentences.chinese: 它既被打翻，族权和夫权便一概跟着动摇起来。

sentences.english: I'm afraid I've knocked your bowl of potpourri on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我打翻了你地上的百花香盆。

sentences.english: The boy inked his clothes when he broke down the ink bottle.
sentences.chinese: 当他把墨水瓶打翻时，他的衣服上沾上了墨水。

sentences.english: A child had knocked over an oil heater , which burst instantly into flames.
sentences.chinese: 一个小孩打翻了煤油炉，火一下子熊熊燃烧起来了。

sentences.english: Johnny's right fist flashed, and the young man went sprawling.
sentences.chinese: 约翰右拳一挥，将年轻人打翻在地。

sentences.english: He knocked over a bottle of ink and ruined the table cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他打翻了一瓶墨水吧桌布弄脏了。

sentences.english: The men at the bar laughed. The wine was poured.
sentences.chinese: 我已经晨昏不分，酒吧里的人都大笑起来，酒打翻了。

sentences.english: Jake had opened the refrigerator and was pouring orange juice on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 杰克打开了冰箱，把橘子汁打翻在地板上。
这名拳击手把对手打翻在地。

definition: to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
